intro: Ardisia ridsdalei, commonly known as the Philippine ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Ardisia ridsdalei is typically found in lowland forests and is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage. However, it is considered a rare and endangered species, facing threats from habitat loss and overcollection.
